abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the First Phase of Adaptable
            Program Loan for National Disaster Vulnerability Reduction
            Project for Colombia were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, risk to development outcome was moderate, Bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was moderately satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: there is existing demand at the municipal
            level for in-depth and continuous technical support for risk
            mitigation actions. Instituto de hidrologia, meteorologia, y
            estudios ambientales, institute of hydrology, meteorology,
            and environment studies (IDEAM's) work has the
            potential to contribute to the development of climate risk
            parametric insurance tools. Such tools can be supported in a
            follow-up operation, and furthermore, use the successful
            experience from other countries in that area. An in-depth
            institutional assessment as well as the preparation of a
            capacity development plan for unidad nacional para la
            gestion del riesgo de desastres, national unit for disaster
            risk management (UNGRD) will help define the institutional
            and implementation arrangements for a potential phase II. In
            terms of monitoring and evaluation (M and E), the project
            demonstrated the limits of a quantitative results framework
            (RF). It highlighted the critical need to design, from
            entry, some indicators and or an M and E system that can
            capture the outcomes produced by the project. There was a
            good synergy between this International Bank for
            Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) operation and global
            facility for disaster reduction and recovery (GFDRR) grants,
            targeting specific areas of technical assistance (TA) and
            delivering extra-outcomes and positive impacts around the project.
